intro: Pimpinella saxifraga subsp. integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth leaf cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its finely divided, pinnate leaves that are typically smooth-edged, giving it its subspecific name "integrifolia." The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable plant for ecological studies.
